intro: Tripudianthes rugosisepala, commonly known as the rough-sepal tripudianthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds.
